728553f-b.title: Richmond: Bay Street - Vanderbilt Avenue
728553f-b.text:
(1)
Bay Street, south from Vanderbilt Avenue. On the east side of the street (left) are the railroad shops of the Staten Island Railroad and fill for the
railroad crossing elimination.
June 7, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A rear view of the railroad yards, seen from the
shore of the Upper Eay.
May 1, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728555f-a.text:
Bay Street, east side, at the foot of Vanderbilt Avenue, showing the Clifton Station of the Staten Island Railroad. The view is eastward down Vanderbilt Avenue. Irg the background are piers on the Upper New York Bay.
January 18, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728557f-a.text:
Bay Street (left), west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. The view is south across part of the new site of the United States Marine Hospital towards Vanderbilt Avenue. Ogg this portion of the site was later erected the new
nurses' home.
June 7, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Across the hospital site towards Vanderbilt Avenue, chowing the area situated between Errington and Talbot Places.
June 7, 1931

(3)
South across the hospital site towards Vanderbilt Avenue, between Talbot Place (left) and Tompkins Avenue. The area ahown in these views was part of the Vanderbilt estate.
June 13, 1931

728558f-a.text:
Bay Street, west side, at Vanderbilt Avenue. The view is south across part of the new site of the United States Marine Hospital,formerly the Vanderbilt estate. This is the western portion of the hospital site and is nearer Tompkins Avenue.
June 7, 1931
L. Sperr
(2)
Anotker view in the same direction. Vanderbilt Avenue runs scross the face of the view from right to left, directly
in front of the houses.
June 13, 1931

corner of Talbot Place.

728562f-b.text:
Bay Street (left), north froa Vanderbilt Avenue, showing, between the east side of the avenue and the Upper Bay, the tracks of the Staten Island Railroad and the beginning of operations on grade crossing elimination. The view is from the end of the station platform.
May. 1,1331
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Viewing north across the station platform. Oth the left are shown buildings of the United States Marine
Hospital.
May 1, 1931

at Bay Street and Vanderbilt Avenue.
May 1, 1931

728554f-a.text:
